intro: Cryptocarya pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Its foliage is evergreen, with glossy, lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive scent when crushed. Cryptocarya pauciflora plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
